events.message: The insured reported a vehicle collision that occurred last night involving their sedan and another car at an intersection.
Based on the initial report, the claim has been categorised under Auto Accident for further processing and evaluation.
An insurance agent specializing in auto claims was assigned to manage and facilitate the claim settlement process.
The claimant received confirmation that their auto accident claim has been acknowledged by the insurance company.
The agent requested additional documentation including the police report, repair estimates, and photos from the accident scene.
All requested documents, including the official police report and mechanic’s assessment of vehicle damage, were submitted by the claimant.
The investigation into the vehicle accident began to verify the cause, liability, and extent of damages claimed.
Investigation concluded confirming the claimant’s vehicle was hit from the side by another car running a red light.
A settlement offer was proposed based on repair costs and coverage limits detailed in the insurance policy.
The claimant expressed dissatisfaction with the initial settlement offer, citing concerns over underestimated repair costs.
Due to feedback regarding the settlement, the claim was escalated to a senior adjuster for reevaluation.
The claim was approved after reassessment, with an increased settlement amount covering additional repair costs.
The approved settlement funds were transferred to the claimant’s account for vehicle repairs and related expenses.
With the payment completed and no further disputes, the auto accident claim case was officially closed.
